[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a novel sanitizable rotary valve for liquid chromatography that can be cleaned and sanitized in place without disassembly, maintaining the sterile condition of the process system.
[Why is it happening?]: This invention is necessary to provide a sanitizable rotary valve that can be intermittently flushed and cleaned while maintaining the sterile condition of the process system, which is crucial for the manufacture of pharmaceuticals.
[Who is involved?]: The inventor, who has designed a completely new type of valve, and the pharmaceutical industry, which benefits from the ability to separate and purify biological macromolecules more efficiently and cost-effectively.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of sanitizing the valve in place (SIP) can happen after continuous operation, as part of a cleaning and sanitizing cycle, and can be repeated as needed.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action of sanitizing the valve in place (SIP) happens within the liquid chromatography system, specifically in the valve assembly that connects to multiple liquid chromatographic columns or solid phase bed segments.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of an improved valve-tray assembly for gas-liquid contacting trays in process columns, which incorporates directional thrust valves and tray construction for higher efficiency operation.
[Why is it happening?]: The invention addresses the need for improved efficiency in gas-liquid contacting trays by providing a method and apparatus for enhanced vapor-liquid flow, increased tray valve density, and reduced back mixing.
[Who is involved?]: The assignee of the present invention, Glitsch, Inc., and other entities such as Union Carbide Corporation and Mitsubishi Jukogyo Kabushiki Kaisha of Tokyo, Japan.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of implementing the improved valve-tray assembly is ongoing, as the invention is a continuation of a U.S. patent application filed on Mar. 8, 1989, and issued as U.S. Pat. No. 4,956,127 on Sept. 11, 1990.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening in the context of distillation columns used in chemical engineering processes, specifically within the trays of trayed columns where liquid and vapor phases interact for separation.

[What is the main point?]: The main point of the invention is to create a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure, addressing the drawbacks of prior art fluid pressure regulators by reducing energy loss and allowing the use of more cost-effective regulators.
[Why is it happening?]: It is happening to convert the potential energy lost in prior art fluid pressure regulators into usable mechanical or electrical power, and to reduce the size and cost of regulators needed for pressure regulation.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves a fluid pressure regulator assembly, which can include a vane motor and a generator, and can be used in various applications such as gas grills, self-contained underwater breathing apparatuses, and medical applications.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of regulating fluid pressure and generating power occurs whenever a pressurized fluid, such as liquid propane or compressed air, is introduced into the system.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening in the fluid pressure regulator assembly, which can be integrated into various devices like gas grills, scuba diving gear, or other systems requiring fluid pressure regulation and energy generation.

[What is the main point?]: The invention is a pallet system designed to support a load of trays, restrict their movement, and enhance stability during shipping.
[Why is it happening?]: The invention addresses the need for a pallet system that limits the lateral and longitudinal movement of loaded items, providing enhanced stability and facilitating automated loading and unloading.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves a pallet system with a pallet base and a pallet cap, which can be customized for different loads.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of loading and securing trays onto the pallet system can be performed when the pallet is ready for shipping.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action of loading and securing trays onto the pallet system occurs at a shipping or warehouse facility where the pallet system is used for transporting goods.

[What is the main point?]: The main point of the invention is to design and construct a compact, efficient, and easily controlled electrical driven flying saucer using magnetic suspension technology to overcome the challenges of limited internal space, noise reduction, vibration control, and reactive torque.
[Why is it happening?]: The invention aims to address the limitations and problems associated with traditional rotary-wing aircrafts by creating a flying saucer with a magnetic suspension system that allows for a more compact structure, reasonable layout, and high power conversion efficiency.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves the design and construction of a magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system, which includes magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, a magnetic suspension shaft, and a magnetic suspension guide rail.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of designing and constructing the electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension is ongoing, as the invention is described in detail in the accompanying drawings and embodiments.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening in the field of aviation aircrafts, specifically in the development of a new type of flying saucer that utilizes magnetic suspension technology for improved performance and safety.

[What is the main point?]: The invention concerns streptavidin muteins with enhanced binding affinity for peptide ligands, which can be used for the isolation, purification, and detection of biological substances, particularly recombinant proteins.
[Why is it happening?]: The invention aims to improve upon the biotin/streptavidin system, which is widely used in molecular biology, by optimizing the affinity between streptavidin and peptide ligands, making it more effective for various applications.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves the use of streptavidin muteins, which are modified versions of streptavidin with specific mutations to enhance their binding affinity for peptide ligands.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of producing and utilizing streptavidin muteins for various applications occurs after the invention has been developed and implemented in laboratories and research facilities.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action of producing and using streptavidin muteins takes place in research and biotechnology laboratories, where scientists and technicians carry out experiments and procedures related to the isolation, purification, and detection of biological substances.

[What is the main point?]: The invention broadly comprises methods of forming substituted guanidines in the presence of a nickel catalyst, offering high yields and minimal reagent use.
[Why is it happening?]: The invention provides a more efficient and environmentally friendly method for synthesizing guanidines, a key structural component in many drugs, by using nickel catalysts to facilitate the reaction between guanylating agents and amines.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves the use of nickel catalysts, guanylating agents (such as thioureas and isothioureas), and amines (including primary and secondary amines).
[When is the action happening?]: The reactions can be carried out at a temperature range of -30-140° C., with room temperature or ambient conditions being preferred.
[Where is the action happening?]: The reactions take place in a solvent system, with suitable solvents including DMF, THF, DMSO, and water mixtures.

[What is the main point?]: The main point of the invention is to provide an apparatus and a method for continuously conducting an anodic oxidation and an electrolytic coloring of an aluminum strip or wire to form a colored anodic coating with excellent weatherability or fade resistance without requiring a large amount of electrical energy.
[Why is it happening?]: This invention is happening to address the need for a continuous, energy-efficient method of producing colored anodic coatings on aluminum strips or wires with high weatherability or fade resistance, which is currently lacking in the prior art methods.
[Who is involved?]: The inventors of the invention, as well as potential users in the aluminum processing industry, are involved in the development and application of this continuous electrolytic coloring apparatus.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of continuously conducting anodic oxidation and electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires is an ongoing process, as the apparatus is designed for continuous operation.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening in an industrial setting where aluminum processing takes place, specifically within the apparatus designed for continuous electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a process for rapidly and efficiently producing transgenic plants with a desired DNA sequence integrated into their chromosomes, which can be used for various applications including DNA library screening and gene function analysis.
[Why is it happening?]: This invention is happening to overcome the limitations of current methods of plant transformation and to provide a versatile, efficient, and in planta process for stable transformation of plants with a DNA sequence of interest.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves plant cells or plants, vectors (precursor vectors), and recombination enzymes or systems.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of transforming plant cells with the invention's process can happen after the plant cells have been provided with the at least two different vectors, followed by site-specific recombination to form a non-replicating recombination product containing the DNA sequence of interest.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening in planta, within the plant cells or whole plants, using methods such as Agrobacterium-mediated transformation or direct gene transfer techniques.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a swash plate type compressor with a durable, low-friction coating that allows the use of lower cost aluminum materials without the need for metal plating or high surface polishing.
[Why is it happening?]: The invention aims to address the high friction and wear issues in swash plate compressors by applying a heat-curable, cross-linked polyfluoro elastomer coating that includes lubricious and load-bearing additives directly to the swash plate, enhancing durability and reducing friction.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves the development of a new swash plate compressor technology, potentially benefiting manufacturers and users of automotive air conditioning systems.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of applying the coating to the swash plate occurs during the manufacturing process, after the swash plate has been roughened to ensure adhesion.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action of coating the swash plate takes place in a manufacturing facility where the swash plates are produced for automotive air conditioning systems.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of novel chemical compounds and preparation methods for organic polymers suitable as anti-reflective coatings in photolithography processes for semiconductor device manufacturing, particularly for 193 nm (ArF) and 248 nm (KrF) light beams.
[Why is it happening?]: It is happening due to the need for efficient anti-reflective coatings that prevent light reflection and diffraction during submicro-pattern formation, which is crucial for the manufacture of advanced semiconductor devices like 64M, 256M, 1G, 4G, and 16G DRAM.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves chemical compounds, polymers, and anti-reflective coatings that can be used in the photolithography process for semiconductor device manufacturing.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of using these polymers and compositions as anti-reflective coatings occurs during the photolithography process in the manufacture of semiconductor devices.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening in the semiconductor manufacturing industry, specifically during the photolithography process used to create submicro-patterns on semiconductor wafers.

[What is the main point?] The main point is the invention of a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic, which has good optical and mechanical properties, and can be produced cost-effectively.
[Why is it happening?] This invention addresses the need for a film suitable for outdoor applications that demands fire protection, flame retardancy, and UV resistance, which were not met by existing films.
[Who is involved?] The inventors and the industry producing and using such films are involved.
[When is the action happening?] The action of producing and using this film is ongoing, as the invention provides a solution for current market needs.
[Where is the action happening?] The action is happening in the context of the film production and application industries, particularly for outdoor and indoor applications requiring these specific properties.

[What is the main point?]: The invention provides a novel process for manufacturing 143a efficiently with high conversion rates and selectivity, avoiding the formation of olefinic byproducts.
[Why is it happening?]: The process is based on continuous gas phase hydrofluorination using heterogeneous catalysis, specifically with chromium catalysts, which allows for high conversion rates and selectivity for 143a without forming undesirable by-products.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves the use of chromium-based catalysts, such as CrF 3 .4H 2  O or Cr/Ni/AlF 3 , and the process can be carried out using various feedstocks like 142b, 141b, HCl, and HF.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of hydrofluorinating 142b to produce 143a can occur under various conditions, including different temperatures (100° C. to 400° C.), HF:142b molar ratios (1:1 to 10:1), and contact times (1-100 seconds).
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening in a reactor suitable for carrying out the process, which can be a fixed bed reactor or an adiabatic reactor, depending on the specific process conditions and requirements.

[What is the main point?]: This invention relates to an improved process for the preparation of certain pyrazolotriazoles from their triazolothiadiazine precursors, which employs hypophosphorous acid to reduce the amount of elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities.
[Why is it happening?]: The use of hypophosphorous acid in the process reduces the formation of undesirable by-products and increases the yield of the desired product.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves the use of hypophosphorous acid in the reaction mixture to improve the process of pyrazolotriazole synthesis.
[When is the action happening?]: The improved process is conducted in two main steps: acylation followed by deacylation and desulfurization, with the deacylation and desulfurization step being conducted in the presence of hypophosphorous acid.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening in a chemical laboratory or industrial setting where the synthesis of pyrazolotriazoles is being carried out.

[What is the main point?]: The invention provides an improved method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from different fiber types by sequentially measuring and removing predetermined partial quantities from each fiber bale, ensuring no fiber residuals and an optimally homogeneous mixture.
[Why is it happening?]: The method eliminates disadvantages of previous methods, such as fluctuating fiber dimensions and uneven processing, by measuring the entire momentary quantity of each fiber bale and removing a calculated partial quantity corresponding to a predetermined proportion.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves a fiber removing apparatus, a quantity measuring apparatus, and a control apparatus that coordinates the operation of the fiber removing apparatus based on signals from the quantity measuring device.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of measuring and removing fiber quantities occurs before each pass of the bale opener, with the process repeated for each fiber bale in a predetermined number of passes.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening at a fiber storage site where fiber bales are stored and arranged for processing. The apparatus measures and removes fiber quantities directly at the location of fiber opening.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with yarns laid at an angle of from 30° to 150° to the long axis of the fabric, held together by stitching, knitting, or adhesive bonding.
[Why is it happening?]: This invention is happening to address the need for stronger non-woven fabrics for structural uses where traditional knitted or woven fabrics are insufficient, even when impregnated with a curable resin system.
[Who is involved?]: The inventor, applicant, and the textile industry are involved in the development and application of this non-woven fabric formation method.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics using this method and apparatus is happening during the fabric manufacturing process.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening in a textile manufacturing facility where the fabric is being formed and bonded together.

[What is the main point?]: The invention provides a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom with varying weft carrying forces suitable for each thread, to ensure stable insertion and prevent undue consumption of pressurized air.
[Why is it happening?]: To address the issue of varying resistances of different weft threads to being drawn for weft insertion and the inefficiency of using uniform air pressure for all threads, which leads to wasted air and unstable weft insertion.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves the design of a multiple-color air jet loom and the creation of a control system that can adjust the weft carrying forces for different weft threads.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of adjusting the weft carrying forces occurs during the weft insertion process in the air jet loom.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening within the air jet loom's weft insertion apparatus, specifically in the pneumatic piping system and the control system that manages the pressurized air supply to the subnozzles and main nozzles.

[What is the main point?]: The main point of the invention is to provide a bast fibre yarn obtained through spinning bast fibres with a simple and efficient process that results in a low end breakage rate, specifically addressing the brittleness and rigidity of bast fibres like jute, kenaf, and hemp.
[Why is it happening?]: Bast fibres need to be humidified for health preservation before spinning to improve flexibility and reduce breakage during the spinning process, but they often become dry and break easily.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves the spinning of bast fibres, such as jute, kenaf, and hemp, and potentially other fibres like cotton or synthetic fibres like terylene or polypropylene.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of spinning the bast fibres occurs after the fibres have undergone health preservation, which can last from 2 to 14 hours, and then drawing and spinning the fibres into yarn.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action of spinning the bast fibres and creating the yarn is taking place in a textile processing environment, likely within a textile mill or factory specializing in bast fibre production.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a method and apparatus for accurately detecting, measuring, and compensating for rotational variability in the nip pressure profile of nip presses used in industries like papermaking.
[Why is it happening?]: It is happening because rotational variability can cause inaccuracies in the nip pressure profile, leading to poor quality products and inefficient operations.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves nip presses used in industries like papermaking, and the machine operators who use the apparatus to measure and correct the nip pressure profile.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of measuring and compensating for rotational variability happens in real-time as the nip press operates.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening within the nip presses and the monitoring systems associated with them, typically in a paper mill or similar industrial setting.

[What is the main point?]: The invention is a combination electrical cord support and holder for an ironing board, useful for supporting the cord of an electric iron and holding an article like a spray starch can or beverage container.
[Why is it happening?]: The invention addresses the need for a convenient and safe way to support the electrical cord of an electric iron while ironing and to store articles nearby without interfering with the ironing process or causing spills.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves an ironing board, an electrical cord support, an article holder, and potentially an electrical outlet for the iron's cord.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of using the invention occurs during the ironing process, when the cord support and article holder are attached to the ironing board.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening on an ironing board, which is the surface where clothes are ironed and where the cord support and article holder are mounted.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a buttonhole controlling device for a sewing machine that can automatically sew buttonholes of the selected length, regardless of the type of material being sewn, to prevent stitching from failing to close or overlapping.
[Why is it happening?]: It is happening because different materials vary in the extent to which they slip relative to the feed dog of a machine during sewing, causing buttonholes to be formed improperly.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves a sewing machine operator and the buttonhole controlling device of the invention.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of using the buttonhole controlling device happens when the operator is sewing buttonholes on a garment.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening on a sewing machine, specifically when the operator is sewing buttonholes on a garment.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of an improved apparatus for treating dyed or printed textile webs with a liquid, such as a washing or rinsing solution, without maintaining the textile web in a stacked configuration.
[Why is it happening?]: This improvement is necessary because the previous methods were unsuitable for materials like knitted fabrics or when the web contained printed matter, as they either required the fabric to be stacked, which could damage the material, or they did not allow sufficient time for the liquid to act on the substances to be removed from the web.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves a fabric treatment apparatus with components such as a conveyor, liquid applicator, suction device, and dwell stretch.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of treating the textile web with the liquid occurs as the web moves along a predetermined path within the apparatus.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening within the fabric treatment apparatus, which includes a machine frame, guide drums, an endless sieve belt, spray pipes, dwell stretch, and suction device, as illustrated in the drawings provided.

[What is the main point?] The main point is the invention of a dry cleaner with an air flow system that minimizes the loss of residual solvent vapors by providing ambient air into the access opening when the door is opened, without exhausting the tubs.
[Why is it happening?] It is happening to minimize the escape of toxic solvent vapors when loading or unloading clothes, and to reduce the loss of expensive and highly volatile solvent vapors by retaining them within the machine.
[Who is involved?] The invention involves a dry cleaner machine with a separate intake fan and duct system, a timer mechanism, and various valves and components for controlling the solvent and air flow.
[When is the action happening?] The action of drawing ambient air into the access opening occurs whenever the door to the machine is opened.
[Where is the action happening?] The action is happening within the dry cleaner machine, specifically in the access opening and the duct system interposed between the access opening and the interior tubs.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a new method and apparatus for forming fine continuous filaments, particularly for creating melt spun nonwoven webs, that addresses the limitations of conventional nonwoven spun bond systems.
[Why is it happening?]: It is happening to improve spinning speed, energy consumption, machine element cleanliness, web uniformity, capital costs, and process control.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves the use of a thermoplastic polymer, a quench chamber, air knives, a drawing slot, and a web forming table.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of spinning the filaments and forming the nonwoven webs happens during the operation of the apparatus, as shown in the schematic flow diagrams.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening within the nonwoven spun bond production system, specifically in the quench chamber, drawing slot, and web forming table.

[What is the main point?] The main point is the development of a sewing machine and embroidery unit that allows for easy positioning of sewing on a work cloth using ultrasonic waves, eliminating the need for physical markers.
[Why is it happening?] This innovation aims to simplify the process of setting sewing positions on a work cloth, making it more convenient for users.
[Who is involved?] The involved parties include the sewing machine manufacturer, the embroidery unit manufacturer, and the end-users (sewers or embroiderers).
[When is the action happening?] The action of setting the sewing position using ultrasonic waves occurs during the operation of the sewing machine.
[Where is the action happening?] The action happens on the sewing machine and the embroidery unit, with the ultrasonic pen used by the user to specify the sewing position on the work cloth.

[What is the main point?] The main point is the invention of a preparation for application onto cellulosic fabric materials that enhances their utility, such as moisture management, UV protection, and anti-bacterial properties, by using wool particles or wool powder and bamboo powder as carriers for functional additives.
[Why is it happening?] It is happening to improve the durability and performance of cellulosic fabric materials with functional additives, as these additives often lose their enhancement after several washing cycles.
[Who is involved?] The invention involves the use of wool particles or wool powder and bamboo powder as carriers for functional additives, which are then applied onto cellulosic fabric materials like cotton or linen.
[When is the action happening?] The action of applying the preparation onto the cellulosic fabric material can happen during the manufacturing process, before the final textile product is made available to consumers.
[Where is the action happening?] The action is happening in the textile industry, specifically in the production of fabrics and textiles that require enhanced utility properties.

[What is the main point?] The main point is the invention of an automatic quilting machine that allows an operator to program and duplicate patterns into large fabrics like bedspreads or quilts remotely, with the capability to independently reprogram the sewing machine functions and the quilting table movements.
[Why is it happening?] This invention is happening to address the inefficiency of reprogramming the entire system when changes are needed in the stitching pattern or table movement, which in the prior art required reprogramming thousands of combined stitch and movement operations.
[Who is involved?] The inventors, manufacturers, and operators of large frame quilting machines are involved, as the invention simplifies the process of pattern programming and duplication.
[When is the action happening?] The action of programming and duplicating patterns into large fabrics is happening during the design and production phases of quilting.
[Where is the action happening?] The action is happening in a frame quilting machine setup, where the fabric is stretched on a metal frame and the machine is controlled remotely through computers and process controllers.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a method for creating a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a pronounced three-dimensional image that is durable to both converting and end-use applications.
[Why is it happening?]: This invention is happening to provide a fabric with enhanced physical properties and an aesthetically pleasing appearance, which can be used in a wide variety of consumer applications.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves textile manufacturers, fabric producers, and potentially end-users in various industries such as home cleaning, personal hygiene, medical, and others.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of manufacturing the nonwoven fabric is happening during the production process of the fabric, as described in the technical field.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action of manufacturing the nonwoven fabric is happening in a textile or fabric production facility, as indicated by the reference to an apparatus for forming the fabric.

[What is the main point?]: The invention is a device that ensures continuous operation of a sewing machine, enabling it to sew relatively stiff strips of material without interruptions or disturbances.
[Why is it happening?]: The invention addresses the issue of sewing machines having difficulty with stiff materials like paperboard, cardboard, plastic, or leather, which can deform the needle and disrupt the sewing process.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves a sewing machine and a device for feeding a strip of material into the machine to be sewn onto a cut of fabric.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of sewing the strip of material onto the cut of fabric happens continuously, with the strip being fed into the machine and the needle sewing the strip onto the cut without manual intervention.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening within a sewing machine, specifically in the feed path of the strip of material and the stitch forming area where the sewing takes place.

[What is the main point?]: The invention provides a connective knitting method for joining two tape-shaped knit pieces in a knitting procedure, which avoids the need for separate sewing processes and manual linking, thereby increasing productivity and reducing manufacturing costs.
[Why is it happening?]: The invention addresses problems associated with traditional methods of linking tape-shaped knit fabrics, such as impaired productivity, increased manufacturing costs, and irregularities in the final product.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds and a controlled computer following a designed knitting pattern.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of knitting and connecting the tape-shaped knit pieces occurs during the manufacturing process of items like sweaters, tanktops, baseball stockings, and aprons.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action of knitting and connecting the tape-shaped knit pieces happens on a flat knitting machine, which is equipped with multiple needle beds that can be moved in a lateral direction.

[What is the main point?]: The invention relates to a flexible traction element with a plurality of stranded cables sheathed in a flexible thermoplastic material, offering increased flexibility and improved long-term adhesion between the cables and the plastic jacket.
[Why is it happening?]: The invention aims to provide a traction element with increased flexibility, improved adhesion, and precise control of cable spacing, even at high production speeds, while also being suitable for various applications including lifts and as electric conductors.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves the creation of a traction element with multiple stranded cables, a production line for embedding these cables in a flexible thermoplastic material, and potentially the users of such traction elements in various industries.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of producing the traction elements and embedding the stranded cables in the thermoplastic material occurs during the manufacturing process, which can be optimized for high-speed production.
[Where is the action happening?]: The production process takes place in an industrial setting, specifically on a production line designed for the manufacture of traction elements.

[What is the main point?]: The invention provides a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine that minimizes the hindrance to the guiding of the needle thread loop and the pull-back of the needle thread loop after maximum expansion, resulting in a jerk-free and low friction motion.
[Why is it happening?]: The holding means are arranged to prevent co-rotation and reverse rotation of the bobbin housing, and the capsule release device gives the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation, creating a gap for the needle thread loop to slip through unhindered.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves a lockstitch sewing machine with a rotary hook, a bobbin housing, a front and rear cam, a spring rod, a capsule release device, and a thread take-up lever.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of guiding and pulling back the needle thread loop occurs during the stitch formation process when the sewing machine is running.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening within the lockstitch sewing machine, specifically in the rotary hook arrangement and the bobbin housing.

[What is the main point?] The main point is the invention of methods for producing silicon-based nanowires and materials using liquid silane inks and electrospinning techniques, which can be used in various applications such as anodes for lithium-ion batteries.
[Why is it happening?] It is happening due to the need for inexpensive and amenable continuous manufacturing processes for silicon-based materials, as traditional methods like chemical vapor deposition and etching are not suitable for such applications.
[Who is involved?] The invention involves North Dakota EPSCoR/National Science Foundation and the DoD Defense Microelectronics Activity (DMEA) as government sponsors, and the invention aims to utilize government-supported research or development.
[When is the action happening?] The action of developing and implementing the invention is ongoing, as indicated by the filing of the application on Oct. 3, 2012, and the related PCT international applications filed on Apr. 6, 2010, and Oct. 3, 2011.
[Where is the action happening?] The action is happening in the field of material science and engineering, specifically in the synthesis of silicon-based nanostructures and materials.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a sewing machine detector that overcomes the disadvantages of conventional detectors by providing a low-cost, durable, and compact detector that minimizes stress on optical fibers and eliminates electrical interference with the control circuitry.
[Why is it happening?]: It is happening to address issues such as vibration-induced malfunctions, high production costs due to curved reflective discs, and electrical interference from power indicating cables.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves sewing machine manufacturers, users, and possibly other stakeholders in the textile and sewing machine industries.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of implementing this invention is ongoing, as it is a continuous improvement in sewing machine technology.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening in the context of sewing machine manufacturing and operation, specifically within the drive and control systems of sewing machines.

[What is the main point?]: The main point of the invention is a simplified and economical process for the continuous production of high-degree-of-whiteness viscose rayon yarns without sacrificing quality or requiring additional treatments.
[Why is it happening?]: The invention aims to address the complexity and space requirements of the traditional viscose rayon spinning process, while improving the degree of whiteness of the yarn.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves the textile industry, particularly those involved in the production of viscose rayon yarns.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of the invention occurs during the continuous spinning process of viscose rayon yarns.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening in spinning machines and treatment facilities where viscose rayon yarns are produced.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a small deaeration tank system for treating pulp that has been oxygenated, which allows for deaeration before washing, with no moving parts and the ability to recover steam or oxygen.
[Why is it happening?]: This invention is necessary to address the problem of oxygen entrained in pulp during the washing stage, which reduces vacuum and mixes with wash water to form foam, hindering the washing process.
[Who is involved?]: The inventors of the system, as well as the pulp and filtrate from the washing process.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of deaerating the pulp occurs after the oxygenation process and before the pulp is washed.
[Where is the action happening?]: The deaeration process takes place in a small tank, which is typically placed on top of or hung from the side of the oxygen reactor tank, and the pulp flows through the system before entering the washer for further processing.

[What is the main point?]: This invention introduces biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio.
[Why is it happening?]: The invention aims to optimize composite materials for specific tasks, using a function-oriented material design (FOMD) process that maximizes out-plane stiffness and treats materials in tension and compression differently.
[Who is involved?]: The invention is developed by the composite materials community, with contributions from the University of Michigan and MKP Structural Design Associates, Inc.
[When is the action happening?]: The invention was developed in the recent past, with ongoing research and development.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening in the field of composite materials, particularly in the design and construction of structures like military air vehicles.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a load-limiting device for braced frames in structures that can dissipate energy during dynamic events like earthquakes, limit structural damage, and be replaced after plastic deformation.
[Why is it happening?]: It happens due to the need for structures to withstand major dynamic events without catastrophic failure, and the desire to limit repair costs and maintain structural integrity.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves structural engineers, architects, and construction professionals who design and build buildings and other structures.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of implementing this load-limiting device occurs during the design, construction, and retrofitting phases of structures prone to seismic activity.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening in the construction and maintenance of buildings, bridges, vehicles, aircraft, furniture, roller-coasters, and any other structures that experience severe dynamic loads or are prone to seismic events.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a bedroom cabinet designed to overcome the disadvantages of conventional bedroom cabinets by providing a flat external surface and internal storage without protrusions, enhancing soundproofing and ventilation.
[Why is it happening?]: The invention aims to address issues with conventional bedroom cabinets, such as reduced dwelling area due to protrusions and soundproofing problems, by creating a dual-construction cabinet with internal storage and ventilation features.
[Who is involved?]: The inventor(s) of the present application and the users who would benefit from the bedroom cabinet.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of assembling and installing the bedroom cabinet is not specified in terms of time.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action of assembling and installing the bedroom cabinet is happening in a site of construction, such as a stadium or workmen's quarters.

[What is the main point?]: A portable guard rail support and assembly for use in erecting a temporary safety barrier is provided.
[Why is it happening?]: Modern construction techniques require safety barriers around uncompleted floors to prevent accidents and protect workmen.
[Who is involved?]: The invention is designed for use by construction workers and safety inspectors.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of erecting the safety barrier can be done by a single worker and is typically performed during the construction phase of a building.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action of erecting the safety barrier happens at construction sites, particularly around the perimeter of uncompleted floors in buildings under construction.

[What is the main point?] The main point is the invention of a pulsed power device and method for enhanced oil recovery (EOR) that uses both electrohydraulic (EH) and electromagnetic (EM) pulsed power discharges to stimulate crude oil reservoirs and separate the recovered hydrocarbons into their components.
[Why is it happening?] This invention aims to address the challenge of Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) by improving the efficiency of hydrocarbon extraction from oil reservoirs, which currently leaves about 66% of discovered oil unrecovered due to ineffective extraction technology.
[Who is involved?] The invention involves the petroleum industry, particularly those interested in improving oil recovery methods.
[When is the action happening?] The action of using this invention is ongoing, as it is a continuation-in-part of a U.S. patent application filed on February 9, 2000.
[Where is the action happening?] The action is happening in oil-bearing soils and rock formations, specifically within the subsurface of the earth where oil reservoirs are located.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a splice system and method for extending the length of soil reinforcing elements used in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures, allowing for the construction of MSE structures with desired reinforcing distances.
[Why is it happening?]: This invention is necessary to effectively extend the length of soil reinforcing elements, which are often not long enough to adequately reinforce vertical facings into adjacent backfill, and to provide additional tensile resistance where required.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves soil reinforcing elements and grid-strips used in MSE structures, as well as the splice system that couples these elements together.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of splicing the soil reinforcing elements and grid-strips together to extend their length occurs during the construction of MSE structures.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action of splicing the soil reinforcing elements and grid-strips together to extend their length happens at construction sites where MSE structures are being built.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a novel plow blade design that efficiently distributes fluid to lubricate and reduce friction during utility line installation.
[Why is it happening?]: This invention is happening to address the need for a less expensive and easily maintainable method of reducing the power required to pull utility lines through the ground during plowing operations.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves a plow blade with a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, constructed with basic manufacturing processes.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of this invention is happening during the installation of utility lines through the ground using a plow.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening in the context of installing utilities such as telephone, television, natural gas, electricity, and drainage lines in shallow underground trenches.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a building system that allows the creation of stucco panels greater than 2.4 meters in height and 4 meters wide without movement control joints, adhering to New Zealand building regulations.
[Why is it happening?]: This invention is happening to overcome the restrictions of current building regulations that limit stucco panels to a maximum height of 2.4 meters and a maximum width of 4 meters, necessitating movement control joints for larger areas.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves building systems, methods, procedures, assemblies, and related components for constructing stucco walls without movement control joints.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of implementing this invention is not time-bound within the provided text, as it describes a continuous improvement in building techniques.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening in New Zealand, where the building regulations currently restrict stucco panel dimensions and require movement control joints for larger areas.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is to provide a new and improved safe and door structure for containing valuable papers and articles.
[Why is it happening?]: It is happening to offer a new and improved readily assembled, low-cost door and safe structure.
[Who is involved?]: The invention is developed by an individual or entity referred to as the applicant, who holds U.S. Pat. No. 4,176,440.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of constructing the safe and door structure is not specified with a particular time frame.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening in the context of the construction and assembly of a floor safe designed to contain valuable papers and articles.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a more accurate method for measuring fluid pressures in geological formations, specifically at a desired depth, without interference from pressures at other depths in the formation.
[Why is it happening?]: This invention is necessary due to the limitations of traditional pressure measuring techniques, which can be influenced by pressures in the formation above and below the measuring apparatus, leading to inaccurate readings.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves civil engineers, hydro-geologists, petroleum engineers, and the groundwater industry, who all require accurate pressure measurements for their respective fields.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of implementing this invention occurs during the installation of a pressure sensing system in a borehole, which includes the steps of drilling the borehole, installing a conduit with a filter, injecting and pumping cement grout, and potentially performing a hydrofracture process.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening in a borehole drilled in a geological formation, where the pressure sensing system is installed to accurately measure the formation pressures at a specific depth.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints with an expansion function that prevents tire fall-in and stuck-in situations, ensures high slip resistance, and is easy to maintain.
[Why is it happening?]: This invention is happening to address the problems of slip resistance, tire safety, and maintenance difficulties associated with traditional rubber and steel expansion joints in vehicle traveling path joints.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves engineers, construction workers, and manufacturers who design, install, and maintain the new jointing structures in transit systems, monorails, road bridges, and footbridges.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of implementing this invention occurs during the construction and maintenance phases of new transit systems, monorails, road bridges, and footbridges.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening at construction sites where these new transit systems, monorails, road bridges, and footbridges are being built or maintained.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is to provide a floor transport system that prevents wheeled hand trucks from contaminating the sanitary environment of a fluid treatment chamber, allowing for the recovery and reuse of the cooling brine solution without the need for decontamination.
[Why is it happening?]: It is happening to circumvent the issue of wheeled hand trucks contaminating the brine solution, which is used for quick cooling of cooked meat products in a sanitary environment, thus preserving resources and achieving economic advantages.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves the use of wheeled hand trucks for transporting meat products into and out of fluid treatment chambers, with the support of a sanitary enclosed floor track system that keeps the truck wheels separate from the brine solution.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of using the enclosed floor track system is ongoing, as it is a continuous process in fluid treatment chambers where meat products are processed and cooled.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening within fluid treatment chambers used in the processing of cooked meat products, such as smoked meat and sausages, to maintain sanitary conditions and facilitate the efficient cooling and transportation of the products.

[What is the main point?]: The invention provides a lock device for a construction machine that prevents the boom from being rotated downward by the weight of the machine.
[Why is it happening?]: To prevent the machine from falling due to vibration, oil leakage, or other issues that could hinder its operation.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves a construction machine, specifically a tractor loader backhoe, with a loader and an excavating device.
[When is the action happening?]: The locking mechanism is engaged when the boom is raised to the highest position and disengaged when the boom is lowered to the lowest position or when the machine is in operation.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening on the construction machine, particularly on the boom and the lock plate components of the machine.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a swimming pool vacuum cleaner with an adjustable suction head that can be easily regulated on a real-time basis during the cleaning operation without needing to adjust the suction source.
[Why is it happening?]: This invention is happening to overcome the drawbacks of prior art devices that lacked a simple way to regulate suction during pool cleaning, as the suction pressure available varies widely from pool to pool.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves the creators of the swimming pool vacuum cleaner and commercial pool cleaning operators who use the vacuum head for continuous cleaning of multiple pools.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of regulating the suction is happening during the pool cleaning operation.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening at the swimming pool where the vacuum cleaner is being used for cleaning.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a retriever apparatus for retrieving a wear bushing from inside the well head without the need to remove the drill bit from the hole.
[Why is it happening?]: It is happening because the present apparatus solves the problems in the current state of the art by providing a retriever tool that can be mounted onto a drill pipe string independently of threading on the pipe, allowing vertical movement of the retriever unit while preventing rotational movement during operation.
[Who is involved?]: The inventors and the oil and gas drilling industry are involved, as this invention pertains to oil well drilling tools and apparatuses.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of retrieving the wear bushing occurs during the drilling process when the drill string is relowered into the hole until the retriever section makes contact with the wear bushing.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening within the well head area of an oil well, specifically in the space between the drill pipe and the well head casing.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of a downhole vibratory tool that selectively allows passage for other tools and improves upon previous designs by solving issues related to utility, reliability, and power delivery.
[Why is it happening?]: It is happening due to the need for a more economical and reliable vibratory tool that can dislodge stuck objects (fish) in a wellbore and also allow for wireline or other tool access without removal of the vibratory tool.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves the tool manufacturers, rig personnel, and potentially the fish stuck in the wellbore.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of the tool dislodging the fish and allowing for wireline access happens during the operation of the tool in a wellbore.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening downhole in the wellbore where the fish is stuck.

[What is the main point?]: The invention provides an apparatus and method for constructing a retaining wall that allows for taller walls and shorter bases by pre-manufacturing parts of the wall for transportation and on-site assembly, saving on installation and transportation costs.
[Why is it happening?]: The invention addresses the limitations of conventional retaining wall designs, such as the need for extensive cuts into the soil behind the wall and the inability to construct tall walls without extensive labor and costly temporary shoring.
[Who is involved?]: The invention involves engineers, construction professionals, and manufacturers of precast concrete components.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of constructing the retaining wall using the invention's method occurs during the construction phase of a project.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action of constructing the retaining wall using the invention's method happens at the construction site where the retaining wall is to be installed.

[What is the main point?]: The main point is the invention of an improved down hole heating system for oil and gas wells to increase flow rates in conditions where flow is impeded due to high oil viscosity and/or paraffin blockage.
[Why is it happening?]: It is happening because existing down hole heating systems are ineffective and prone to failure due to lack of focus on heat application and vulnerability to down hole fluids.
[Who is involved?]: The inventor, producers of oil and gas wells, and various companies providing materials and components for the heating system.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of implementing the improved down hole heating system is not time-specific and can occur during well treatments or maintenance when the well is accessed.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening in the well bore of oil and gas wells where the heating system is installed to improve flow rates.

[What is the main point?]: The invention provides a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, specifically designed for effectively connecting and disconnecting pull tools from objects like fish, which are stuck or lost within a well bore.
[Why is it happening?]: The invention aims to address the common problem of inability to disconnect a pulling tool from a worn fishing neck in well operations, which can complicate retrieval operations and increase costs.
[Who is involved?]: The invention is intended for use by service personnel in well servicing operations, including drilling and production operations.
[When is the action happening?]: The action of installing and removing objects using the invention can occur during various well servicing operations, whenever a pull tool needs to be connected or disconnected from an object within the well bore.
[Where is the action happening?]: The action is happening within the well bore, specifically in the casing and tubing strings of the well.
